none.description: almost perfect recognized transcript (e.g. differing comma/space/hyphen placement, repeated words and disfluencies are fine)

minor.description: easily able to read through (e.g. incorrect capitalisation, pronouns/prepositions, omission of secondary detail)

standard.description: disrupts the flow and comprehension (e.g. misrecognized/omitted names, homophones/sound-alikes, omission of primary detail)

serious.description: misinformation which changes meaning (e.g. alternative names/numbers, incorrect word endings/contractions, omission causing misinformation)

examples.reference: This has been confirmed by the Pentagon.
examples.recognised: This hasn't been confirmed by the Pentagon.
examples.reason: The word 'has' is reversed which causes misinformation about the message
